photo.description: Le Château de la Madeleine est un château médiéval situé à Chevreuse, dans le sud du département des Yvelines. Son donjon et ses remparts imposants en font un édifice exceptionnel qui surplombe la vallée de l’Yvette de son empreinte majestueuse. Histoire, patrimoine et environnement se conjuguent dans un site unique. <a href"http:www.yvelines.frloisirsle-chateau-de-la-madeleine" rel"nofollow"><strong>En savoir plus<strong> <a>

photo.description: After passing Place de la Concorde, our coach heading straight north up Rue Royale towards the Church of the Madeleine. modeled after a greek temple, it was began in 1764, but consecrated as a church until 1845. In French it is the Église de la Madeleine. (English it's the Church of the Madeleine). L'église de la Madeleine (more formally, L'église Sainte-Marie-Madeleine; less formally, just La Madeleine), Madeleine Church in English, is a Roman Catholic church occupying a commanding position in the 8th arrondissement of Paris. It was designed in its present form as a temple to the glory of Napoleon's army. To its south lies the Place de la Concorde, to the east is the Place Vendôme, and to the west L'église Saint-Augustin. It is in Place de la Madeleine.

photo.description: Pluviers siffleurs. Les Îles-de-la-Madeleine sont le seul endroit au Québec où niche cet oiseau menacé d'extinction à l'échelle mondiale. &quot;Le pluvier siffleur est une espèce d'oiseau de rivage en voie de disparition qui niche et qui se nourrit le long du littoral, sur les plages de sable et de galets. Les adultes se reconnaissent à leur taille, à leur forme et à la couleur de leur plumage. De la taille d'un moineau environ, ils ont les pattes orange, une bande noire sur le front qui va d'un œil à l'autre, et un « collier » noir autour du cou. Leur corps se distingue par sa couleur sable, ce qui leur permet de se camoufler facilement dans leur habitat. &quot; <a href"http:www.pc.gc.caapprendre-learnprofsubecoitm5fi-lr2plover-pluvier_F.asp">www.pc.gc.caapprendre-learnprofsubecoitm5fi-lr2plo...<a>
photo.tags: de island la madeleine piping plover magdalen iles pluvier siffleur
photo.title: Pluviers Siffleurs Piping Plovers

photo.description: Square in Aix-en-Provence with law courts and an old church. This old church in Aix-en-Provence is the L'Eglise de la Madeleine. Old Dominican Church built in the 13th century and transformed in the 17th century. The front dates from the 19th century. Closed for restoration in 2011. Sure I saw graffiti that said &quot;no photos&quot; in French (didn't want to take that though). <a href"http:fr.wikipedia.orgwiki%c3%89glise_de_la_Madeleine_d'Aix-en-Provence" rel"nofollow">eglise de la madeleine d'aix-en-provence<a> The Church of the Madeleine is a religious building up of Preachers at Aix-en-Provence . This place owes its name to a convent Dominican foundations on which was erected the church of Sainte-Madeleine, more commonly called Church of the Madeleine, from 1691 to 1703 by architect Laurent Vallon. The Aachen architect Henry Revoil reworked the facade in 1855 to 1860 . The building has long been considered the most beautiful building of worship in the Bouches-du-Rhone . Fonscolombe Emmanuel (1810-1875) is one of the most famous masters of the chapel. The Madeleine church is undergoing renovation and stabilization of the building. The site is closed to the public since 2006 and is expected to reopen in 2013 , according to Hall . It is the subject of a classification as historical monuments since 24 October 1988 History In 1363 , a fire ravaged the Dominican convent of priors. It is this event and the dilapidated building that encourages consuls from Aix to apply for reconstruction under the leadership of Guigonnet Jarente , Lord of Monclar and Gémenos , a supporter of the Second House of Anjou After the death of Queen Jeanne . While Jarente died on 20 January 1401 , before completion, it is buried in the sanctuary of the church . Organ The organ of the Madeleine, which contains 3,500 pipes, is the work of Jean-Esprit Isnard and date of 1743 . This will build the organ in the cathedral two years later. The buffet is crowned arms of Pope Pius VI. I later came back to the square and got a decent shot of the church and fountain. This is the <a href"http:www.gralon.nettourismeloisirs-culturelsinfo-fontaine-et-place-des-precheurs-aix-en-provence-4874.htm" rel"nofollow">La fontaine des Prêcheurs<a> in Place des Prêcheurs. Designed by Jean Chastel Pankration in the eighteenth century, it consists of an obelisk supported by lions at the corners. Among these animals, there are four medallions: Sextus, the founder of the Roman city, Charles III of Maine, who left Provence to the king of France, Louis XV and the count of Provence, later Louis XVIII. <a href"http:www.mairie-aixenprovence.frPlace-Precheurs" rel"nofollow">Place Precheurs<a> The fountain of Preachers is decorated in 1748 by Jean Chastel Pankration four medallions, destroyed in 1793 and then reinstated in 1833, restored in large part due to American patronage.
photo.tags: france fountain lion aixenprovence obelisk lions restoration provence southoffrance aix historicalmonument bouchesdurhone provencealpescotedazur churchofthemadeleine placedesprêcheurs sextus jeanespritisnard laurentvallon leglisedelamadeleine popepiusvi bouchesdurhoneandnimes aixcentre eglisedelamadeleinedaixenprovence churchofthemadeleineinaixenprovence religiousbuildingupofpreachers olddominicanchurch churchofsaintemadeleine henryrevoil dominicanconventofpriors guigonnetjarente lafontainedesprêcheurs jeanchastelpankration fourmedallions charlesiiiofmaine
photo.title: L'Eglise de la Madeleine and La fontaine des Prêcheurs - Place des Prêcheurs- Aix-en-Provence

Sure I saw graffiti that said &quot;no photos&quot; in French (didn't want to take that though). <a href"http:fr.wikipedia.orgwiki%c3%89glise_de_la_Madeleine_d'Aix-en-Provence" rel"nofollow">eglise de la madeleine d'aix-en-provence<a> The Church of the Madeleine is a religious building up of Preachers at Aix-en-Provence . This place owes its name to a convent Dominican foundations on which was erected the church of Sainte-Madeleine, more commonly called Church of the Madeleine, from 1691 to 1703 by architect Laurent Vallon. The Aachen architect Henry Revoil reworked the facade in 1855 to 1860 . The building has long been considered the most beautiful building of worship in the Bouches-du-Rhone . Fonscolombe Emmanuel (1810-1875) is one of the most famous masters of the chapel. The Madeleine church is undergoing renovation and stabilization of the building. The site is closed to the public since 2006 and is expected to reopen in 2013 , according to Hall . It is the subject of a classification as historical monuments since 24 October 1988 History In 1363 , a fire ravaged the Dominican convent of priors. It is this event and the dilapidated building that encourages consuls from Aix to apply for reconstruction under the leadership of Guigonnet Jarente , Lord of Monclar and Gémenos , a supporter of the Second House of Anjou After the death of Queen Jeanne . While Jarente died on 20 January 1401 , before completion, it is buried in the sanctuary of the church . Organ The organ of the Madeleine, which contains 3,500 pipes, is the work of Jean-Esprit Isnard and date of 1743 . This will build the organ in the cathedral two years later. The buffet is crowned arms of Pope Pius VI. Door of the church.

photo.description: We were on the way to The Camargue, when we stopped off in this small town near a Lagoon, not too far away from Marseille. The Etang de Berre, situated between Marseille and the Camargue, has the largest petroleum refinery industry in France, which dominates the landscape. However, on the inland side of the Canal de Caronte is the former fishing port and artists' colony of Martigues, which still attracts a holiday crowd. Martigues lies on both banks of the canal and on the island of Brescon, where the Pont San Sebastien is a popular place for artists to set up their easels. Felix Ziem (1821-1911) was the most ardent admirer of this &quot;little Venice&quot;; his paintings and works by contemporary artists can be viewed in the Musee Ziem. From DK Eyewitness Travel: Provence &amp; The Cote D'Azur <a href"http:en.wikipedia.orgwikiMartigues" rel"nofollow">Martigues<a> on Wikipedia Martigues (Occitan: Lo Martegue in classical norm, Lou Martegue in Mistralian norm) is a commune northwest of Marseille. It is part of the Bouches-du-Rhône department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region on the eastern end of the Canal de Caronte. A direct translation from the Martigues Tourisme Website reveals the following about Martigues: Nicknamed the &quot;Provençale Venice&quot;, Martigues is a point of passage between the Mediterranean Sea and the Sea of Martigues (now Etang de Berre), close to the Côte d'Azur. The charm of its canals, its docks and bridges made it &quot;The Venice of Provence&quot;. Martigues possesses also its cooperative winery &quot;La Venise provençale&quot;: Coteaux d'Aix en Provence, rosé, red and white wines, fruit juices and natural oils in the region. Main varietals: Grenache, Syrah, Cinsault, Carignan, Clairette. A church in Quai Marceau, Martigues. It is l'église Sainte-Madeleine. The Church of Sainte-Madeleine (Martigues) (Church of the Madeleine), Ward Island, baroque style, was built between 1681 and 1688. Its interior is richly decorated with murals and woodwork, original flat ceiling with wood paintings. A beautiful organ of the mid-nineteenth century is present, it is classified as historical monuments. Rich carved facade and bell tower topped by an iron bell. It is in Quai Marceau.

photo.description: Propriété du Conseil général, le château de la Madeleine, situé sur les hauteurs de Chevreuse, offre un superbe panorama sur la vallée de l'Yvette. Magnifique forteresse, il a été construit entre le XIe et le XIVe siècle. La Maison du Parc (naturel régional de la Haute Vallée de Chevreuse) a été édifiée à l'intérieur de l'enceinte du château. Le visiteur peut découvrir librement la cour intérieure, les remparts et la vue panoramique sur la vallée de Chevreuse, les caves (exposition sur l'histoire du château) et la Tour des Gardes. Copyright : Laurent Schneiter
photo.title: Château de la Madeleine
